J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> Chad Woolley wrote:
>>So, this means that there may be some duplication in setting up portions 
>>> of the
>>> fixture code (the part that assigns the value to param1, for example).  
>>> However,
>>> this duplication should be addressed in other ways, such as 
>>> consolidating the
>>> common logic to a setUp() method and instance variables, or pulling it 
>>> out to a
>>> superclass or utility class, if it needs to be used across multiple 
>>> TestCases.
>>> Does that sound right too?
> 
> 
> I might do that. I might otherwise push the test data creation to a 
> Factory Object and have each test use the new factory.

Right.  I believe this Factory Object approach is a simple version of 
the "Object Mother" pattern.

A description and examples of more complex implementations of the Object 
Mother pattern are here:

http://c2.com/cgi/wiki?ObjectMother
http://www.xpuniverse.com/2001/pdfs/Testing03.pdf

Thanks,
Chad
